prompt: Facts: Marriage between Bhaskar Lal Sharma (Appellant 1) and Monica (Respondent) solemnized on 16.02.1999.; Monica allegedly left the matrimonial home on 14.07.1999 due to harassment and dowry demands.; Monica filed an FIR (Crime No. 276/1999) on 03.10.1999 at Police Station Kotwali, Alwar (Rajasthan) against Bhaskar Lal Sharma (husband), Bimla Devi (mother-in-law, Appellant 2), and other relatives (father-in-law, brother-in-law).; Allegations in FIR included demands for a Maruti car and cash (initially Rs. 50,000, later Rs. 1,00,000), physical and mental torture, and non-return of 'stridhan' articles.; Offences alleged in FIR: Sections 498A, 406 of the Indian Penal Code (IPC) and Sections 3 and 4 of the Dowry Prohibition Act, 1961.; Police investigated and submitted a charge sheet against the appellants (husband and mother-in-law) under Sections 498A and 406 IPC.; The learned Additional Chief Judicial Magistrate, Alwar took cognizance of the offences.; Appellants filed an application under Section 227 of the Code of Criminal Procedure (CrPC) for discharge before the Trial Court.; The Trial Court dismissed the discharge application vide order dated 07.03.2001, finding sufficient grounds to proceed.; Appellants filed a Criminal Revision Petition (No. 204/2001) before the High Court of Judicature for Rajasthan at Jaipur Bench.; The High Court dismissed the revision petition vide order dated 17.01.2007, upholding the Trial Court's order.; Appellants challenged the High Court's order before the Supreme Court via Special Leave Petition, leading to this appeal.; The core issue before the Supreme Court was whether a prima facie case existed to frame charges under Sections 498A and 406 IPC against the appellants. | IPC: Section 406, Section 498A
